messages.subject: Re: dandelions
messages.msgSnippet: ... spinach. ... *I ve tried that, but they are so bitter.  Is there a way to make them not so bitter? Melanie In Indiana
messages.messageBody:
> when I was young, my grandmother used to cook dandelion greens like
spinach.
> Johanna
*I've tried that, but they are so bitter. Is there a way to
make them not so bitter?

Melanie In Indiana

messages.subject: dandelions
messages.msgSnippet: Tracy, I have no clue what manky sleepers are.  My yard is covered in dandelions. I actually like them though.  They remind me when I was little and my son
messages.messageBody:
Tracy,
I have no clue what manky sleepers are.  My yard is covered in dandelions. I actually like them though.  They remind me when I was little and my son loves to eat the leaves.-Collette
 
when I was young, my grandmother used to cook dandelion greens like spinach.
Johanna

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: dandelions
messages.msgSnippet: You have to eat them YOUNG.  We don t cook them either.  That might make a difference. -Collette ... From: vouget@hotmail.com To:
